{"step_by_step_thinking": "The relevant document is the first one, 'Odontodysplasia. Report of two cases and review of the literature.' According to this report, Regional Odontodysplasia affects the tooth structures in both deciduous and permanent dentitions. The enamel is thin and uneven in thickness, and the dential tissue surrounds very large pulp chambers. Maxilla is involved twice as frequently as mandible. Most of the affected teeth are in the anterior segments; however, all other teeth can be affected. Therefore, Regional Odontodysplasia is most common in maxilla.", "answer_choice": "D"}
